CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length of land registry proceedings);Violation of Art. 13;No separate issue under P1-1;Remainder inadmissible (length of inheritance proceedings);Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s mother died on CARDINAL DATE and inheritance proceedings were opened before the ORG ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court issued a decision distributing the property between the applicant and his brother . The relevant part of that decision reads :
... the land registry division of this court shall register the ownership of the heirs [ listed above ] , once [ that part of the decision ] becomes final ...
CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicant ’s brother lodged an appeal against that decision complaining about the ruling on the costs of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) declared the appeal inadmissible . The decision was served on the applicant ’s representative on DATE .
CARDINAL . It would appear that the applicant ’s ownership of the inherited property has to date not been recorded in the land register .
